definition[0]: a situation in which the goods coming into or going out of a country are not controlled or taxed
definition[1]: a system in which goods can be bought and sold between countries without any restrictions such as TARIFFs (=taxes) or QUOTAs (=limits on imports)
example[0]: Quebec Liberals strongly support free trade with the US.
example[1]: an agreement on bilateral free trade (=free trade between two countries) between Brazil and Venezuela.
example[2]: We aim at bringing the Pacific region rapidly into a US-sponsored Free Trade Area, en route to multilateral free trade (=free trade between many countries).
